meanings.definition: Bokes (noun): plural of 'boke', meaning a retching or vomiting sound.
meanings.sent1: The loud bokes coming from the sick child made everyone worry.
meanings.sent2: The bokes of the dog after eating something bad were heard throughout the house.
meanings.sent3: The bokes of the baby during the car ride were not a pleasant experience for the parents.
meanings.sent4: The bokes of the old car engine sounded like it was about to give up.
meanings.sent5: The bokes of the cat trying to cough up a hairball echoed in the room.

meanings.definition: Bokes (verb): third person singular present of 'boke', meaning to retch or vomit.
meanings.sent1: She bokes every time she smells that strong perfume.
meanings.sent2: The dog bokes whenever it eats too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The thought of eating snails makes him bokes uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The smell of rotten eggs bokes him more than anything else.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster ride made her bokes all over her friend's shoes.
